name: Cherry Cheesecake Brownies
author: My Hot Southern Mess
summary: The delicious combination of chocolate and cherry cheesecake swirled up into a brownie that your family and friends will love, and they can be made gluten-free to boot! Serve them warm or cold and store leftovers in the refrigerator.
ingredients: 1 cup gluten-free all purpose baking flour
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Melt butter in the microwave, about 1 minute
Stir in sugar and cocoa powder
Blend in eggs one at a time using an electric mixer; add vanilla extract
Combine flour (see Cook's Note), baking powder, and salt in a small bowl and add to batter
Mix until well combined and pour into the prepared baking pan
Level with a knife or spatula
Beat together cream cheese, sugar and 1 egg in a second bowl until smooth
Dollop the cream cheese mixture on top of the brownie batter
Separate cherries from the the jelled filling and dollop them over the cream cheese mixture, saving leftover jelly for another use if desired
Bake in the preheated oven until brownies are set and edges pull away from the sides of the pan, 35 to 45 minutes
Remove from oven and cool thoroughly before cutting into bars
